intro: Trymalium odoratissimum subsp. trifidum, commonly known as the fragrant trymalium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its subspecies trifidum is distinguished by its trifid (three-lobed) leaves, which are a key identifying feature. The plant's botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
